title: The Business Behind Airports & What It’s Like To Live In One
description: Tom Pallini, aviation reporter for Business Insider, recently wrote about his experience living at "the best airport in the world." He chats with Scott and Nora about the business of airports including how airports operate and make money, why many U.S. airports look like decaying malls, and what’s being done to improve them.
itunes:title: The Business Behind Airports & What It’s Like To Live In One
itunes:author: Morning Brew
itunes:subtitle: Turns out the massive airport Toblerone is a pretty good value
